name: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
instructions: Rinse quinoa under cold water until water runs clear
In a medium saucepan, bring vegetable broth to a boil
Add quinoa, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes
Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork
In a large bowl, combine cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives
Add cooled quinoa to the bowl
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently
Top with feta cheese and fresh parsley
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days
description: A refreshing and nutritious Mediterranean-inspired quinoa bowl packed with fresh vegetables, herbs, and Mediterranean flavors. Perfect for a light lunch or dinner.

name: Asian Stir-Fry with Tofu
ingredients: 14 oz firm tofu, pressed and cubed
2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas)
instructions: Press tofu for 15 minutes, then cut into 1-inch cubes
Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat
Add tofu cubes and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes
Remove tofu and set aside
Add remaining oil to the same pan
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds until fragrant
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and cornstarch
Return tofu to the pan with vegetables
Pour sauce over everything and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds
Serve immediately over rice or noodles
description: A vibrant and flavorful Asian stir-fry featuring crispy tofu and fresh vegetables in a savory sauce. Quick to prepare and packed with plant-based protein.

name: Mexican Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat
Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes
Add garlic and jalapeño, cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add black beans, cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika
Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes
Add vegetable broth and use a potato masher to partially mash the beans
Season with salt and pepper, cook for 5-7 minutes until thickened
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave
Fill each tortilla with black bean mixture
Top with avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, and cilantro
Serve with lime wedges and enjoy!
description: Delicious and satisfying Mexican black bean tacos that are both healthy and flavorful. Perfect for a quick weeknight dinner or casual gathering.

name: Italian Zucchini Pasta
instructions: Using a spiralizer or julienne peeler, create zucchini noodles
Place zucchini noodles in a colander, sprinkle with salt, and let sit for 10 minutes
Pat dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add white wine and vegetable broth, bring to a simmer
Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 2-3 minutes until softened
Add zucchini noodles and toss gently for 2-3 minutes until heated through
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil
Serve immediately topped with Parmesan cheese and pine nuts
Season with salt and pepper to taste
description: A light and healthy Italian-inspired dish using zucchini noodles instead of pasta. Fresh, flavorful, and perfect for a low-carb meal.

name: Indian Chickpea Curry
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat
Add diced onion and cook until golden brown, about 8-10 minutes
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add curry powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper
Stir constantly for 1 minute to toast the spices
Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes until they break down
Add chickpeas and stir to combine
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes until sauce thickens
Season with salt to taste
Garnish with fresh cilantro
Serve over basmati rice
description: A rich and aromatic Indian chickpea curry with complex spices and creamy coconut milk. A hearty vegetarian dish that's perfect for a comforting dinner.
